member.name: P:Nest.IAlias.Filter
member.summary: Provides an easy way to create different "views" of the same index. A filter can be defined using Query DSL and is applied to all Search, Count, Delete By Query and More Like This operations with this alias.

member.name: P:Nest.IAlias.IndexRouting
member.summary: Associates routing values with aliases for index operations. This feature can be used together with filtering aliases in order to avoid unnecessary shard operations.

member.name: P:Nest.IAlias.Routing
member.summary: Associates routing values with aliases for both index and search operations. This feature can be used together with filtering aliases in order to avoid unnecessary shard operations.

member.name: P:Nest.IAlias.SearchRouting
member.summary: Associates routing values with aliases for search operations. This feature can be used together with filtering aliases in order to avoid unnecessary shard operations.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Shingle(System.Func{Nest.ShingleTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IShingleTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type shingle that constructs shingles (token n-grams) from a token stream.
In other words, it creates combinations of tokens as a single token.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Stop(System.Func{Nest.StopTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IStopTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type stop that removes stop words from token streams.

member.summary: The synonym token filter allows to easily handle synonyms during the analysis process.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.SynonymGraph(System.Func{Nest.SynonymGraphTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ISynonymGraphTokenFilter})
member.summary: The synonym_graph token filter allows to easily handle synonyms, including multi-word synonyms correctly during the analysis process.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.WordDelimiter(System.Func{Nest.WordDelimiterTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type asciifolding that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are
not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the “Basic Latin” Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if one exists.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.WordDelimiterGraph(System.Func{Nest.WordDelimiterGraphTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type asciifolding that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are
not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the “Basic Latin” Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if one exists.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.AsciiFolding(System.Func{Nest.AsciiFoldingTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IAsciiFoldingTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type asciifolding that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are
not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the “Basic Latin” Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if one exists.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.CommonGrams(System.Func{Nest.CommonGramsTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ICommonGramsTokenFilter})
member.summary:
Token filter that generates bigrams for frequently occuring terms. Single terms are still indexed.
Note, common_words or common_words_path field is required.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.DelimitedPayload(System.Func{Nest.DelimitedPayloadTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IDelimitedPayloadTokenFilter})
member.summary: Splits tokens into tokens and payload whenever a delimiter character is found.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Elision(System.Func{Nest.ElisionTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IElisionTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter which removes elisions. For example, “l’avion” (the plane) will tokenized as “avion” (plane).

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Hunspell(System.Func{Nest.HunspellTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IHunspellTokenFilter})
member.summary:
Basic support for hunspell stemming.
Hunspell dictionaries will be picked up from a dedicated hunspell directory on the filesystem.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KeepTypes(System.Func{Nest.KeepTypesTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKeepTypesTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type keep that only keeps tokens with text contained in a predefined set of words.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KeepWords(System.Func{Nest.KeepWordsTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKeepWordsTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type keep that only keeps tokens with text contained in a predefined set of words.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KeywordMarker(System.Func{Nest.KeywordMarkerTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKeywordMarkerTokenFilter})
member.summary: Protects words from being modified by stemmers. Must be placed before any stemming filters.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KStem(System.Func{Nest.KStemTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKStemTokenFilter})
member.summary:
The kstem token filter is a high performance filter for english.
All terms must already be lowercased (use lowercase filter) for this filter to work correctly.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Length(System.Func{Nest.LengthTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ILengthTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type length that removes words that are too long or too short for the stream.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.LimitTokenCount(System.Func{Nest.LimitTokenCountTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ILimitTokenCountTokenFilter})
member.summary: Limits the number of tokens that are indexed per document and field.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Lowercase(System.Func{Nest.LowercaseTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ILowercaseTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type lowercase that normalizes token text to lower case.
Lowercase token filter supports Greek and Turkish lowercase token filters through the language parameter.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.NGram(System.Func{Nest.NGramTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.INGramTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type nGram.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.PatternCapture(System.Func{Nest.PatternCaptureTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IPatternCaptureTokenFilter})
member.summary: The pattern_capture token filter, unlike the pattern tokenizer, emits a token for every capture group in the regular expression.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.PatternReplace(System.Func{Nest.PatternReplaceTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IPatternReplaceTokenFilter})
member.summary: The pattern_replace token filter allows to easily handle string replacements based on a regular expression.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.PorterStem(System.Func{Nest.PorterStemTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IPorterStemTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type porterStem that transforms the token stream as per the Porter stemming algorithm.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Reverse(System.Func{Nest.ReverseTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IReverseTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type reverse that simply reverses the tokens.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Snowball(System.Func{Nest.SnowballTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ISnowballTokenFilter})
member.summary: A filter that stems words using a Snowball-generated stemmer.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Standard(System.Func{Nest.StandardTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IStandardTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type standard that normalizes tokens extracted with the Standard Tokenizer.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Stemmer(System.Func{Nest.StemmerTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IStemmerTokenFilter})
member.summary: A filter that stems words (similar to snowball, but with more options).

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.StemmerOverride(System.Func{Nest.StemmerOverrideTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IStemmerOverrideTokenFilter})
member.summary: Overrides stemming algorithms, by applying a custom mapping, then protecting these terms from being modified by stemmers. Must be placed before any stemming filters.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Trim(System.Func{Nest.TrimTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ITrimTokenFilter})
member.summary: The trim token filter trims surrounding whitespaces around a token.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Truncate(System.Func{Nest.TruncateTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ITruncateTokenFilter})
member.summary:
The truncate token filter can be used to truncate tokens into a specific length. This can come in handy with keyword (single token)
based mapped fields that are used for sorting in order to reduce memory usage.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Unique(System.Func{Nest.UniqueTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IUniqueTokenFilter})
member.summary: The unique token filter can be used to only index unique tokens during analysis. By default it is applied on all the token stream

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Uppercase(System.Func{Nest.UppercaseTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IUppercaseTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type uppercase that normalizes token text to upper case.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Fingerprint(System.Func{Nest.FingerprintTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IFingerprintTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type fingerprint The fingerprint token filter that emits a single token which is useful for fingerprinting a body of text, and/or providing a token that can be clustered on. It does this by sorting the tokens, deduplicating and then concatenating them back into a single token.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiStemmer(System.Func{Nest.KuromojiStemmerTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiStemmerTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_stemmer token filter normalizes common katakana spelling variations ending in a long sound character by removing this character (U+30FC). Only full-width katakana characters are supported. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiReadingForm(System.Func{Nest.KuromojiReadingFormTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiReadingFormTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_readingform token filter replaces the token with its reading form in either katakana or romaji. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiPartOfSpeech(System.Func{Nest.KuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_part_of_speech token filter removes tokens that match a set of part-of-speech tags. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuCollation(System.Func{Nest.IcuCollationTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuCollationTokenFilter})
member.summary: Collations are used for sorting documents in a language-specific word order. The icu_collation token filter is available to all indices and defaults to using the DUCET collation, which is a best-effort attempt at language-neutral sorting. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuFolding(System.Func{Nest.IcuFoldingTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuFoldingTokenFilter})
member.summary: Case folding of Unicode characters based on UTR#30, like the ASCII-folding token filter on steroids. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuNormalization(System.Func{Nest.IcuNormalizationTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuNormalizationTokenFilter})
member.summary: Normalizes as defined here: http://userguide.icu-project.org/transforms/normalization Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuTransform(System.Func{Nest.IcuTransformTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuTransformTokenFilter})
member.summary: Transforms are used to process Unicode text in many different ways, such as case mapping, normalization, transliteration and bidirectional text handling. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.EdgeNGram(System.Func{Nest.EdgeNGramTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IEdgeNGramTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type edgeNGram.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.NGram(System.Func{Nest.NGramTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.INGramTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type nGram.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Keyword(System.Func{Nest.KeywordTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IKeywordTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type keyword that emits the entire input as a single input.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Letter(System.Func{Nest.LetterTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.ILetterTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type letter that divides text at non-letters. That’s to say, it defines tokens as maximal strings of adjacent letters.
Note, this does a decent job for most European languages, but does a terrible job for some Asian languages, where words are not separated by spaces.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Lowercase(System.Func{Nest.LowercaseTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.ILowercaseTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type lowercase that performs the function of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter together.
It divides text at non-letters and converts them to lower case.
While it is functionally equivalent to the combination of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter,
there is a performance advantage to doing the two tasks at once, hence this (redundant) implementation.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.PathHierarchy(System.Func{Nest.PathHierarchyTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IPathHierarchyTokenizer})
member.summary:
The path_hierarchy tokenizer takes something like this:
/something/something/else
And produces tokens:
/something
/something/something
/something/something/else

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Pattern(System.Func{Nest.PatternTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IPatternTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Standard(System.Func{Nest.StandardTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IStandardTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type standard providing grammar based tokenizer that is a good tokenizer for most European language documents.
The tokenizer implements the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm, as specified in Unicode Standard Annex #29.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.UaxEmailUrl(System.Func{Nest.UaxEmailUrlTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IUaxEmailUrlTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type uax_url_email which works exactly like the standard tokenizer, but tokenizes emails and urls as single tokens

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Whitespace(System.Func{Nest.WhitespaceTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IWhitespaceTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type whitespace that divides text at whitespace.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Kuromoji(System.Func{Nest.KuromojiTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Icu(System.Func{Nest.IcuTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IIcuTokenizer})
member.summary: Tokenizes text into words on word boundaries, as defined in UAX #29: Unicode Text Segmentation. It behaves much like the standard tokenizer, but adds better support for some Asian languages by using a dictionary-based approach to identify words in Thai, Lao, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean, and using custom rules to break Myanmar and Khmer text into syllables. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.PutMappingDescriptor`1.AutoMap(Nest.IPropertyVisitor,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Convenience method to map as much as it can based on ElasticType attributes set on the type.
This method also automatically sets up mappings for primitive values types (e.g. int, long, double, DateTime...)
Class types default to object and Enums to int
Later calls can override whatever is set by this call.

This method also automatically sets up mappings for primitive values types (e.g. int, long, double, DateTime...)
Class types default to object and Enums to int
Later calls can override whatever is set by this call.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorDescriptorBase`2.If(System.String)
member.summary: A painless script predicate that can control whether this processor should be executed or not

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorDescriptorBase`2.Tag(System.String)
member.summary: A tag is simply a string identifier of the specific instantiation of a certain processor in a pipeline. The tag field does not affect the processor’s behavior, but is very useful for bookkeeping and tracing errors to specific processors.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorDescriptorBase`2.IgnoreFailure(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: When a failure happens, ignore it and proceed to the next processor

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.Attachment``1(System.Func{Nest.AttachmentProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IAttachmentProcessor})
member.summary: The ingest attachment plugin lets Elasticsearch extract file attachments in common formats (such as PPT, XLS, and PDF) by using the Apache text extraction library Tika. You can use the ingest attachment plugin as a replacement for the mapper attachment plugin.
member.remarks: Requires the Ingest Attachment Processor Plugin to be installed on the cluster.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.DateIndexName``1(System.Func{Nest.DateIndexNameProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IDateIndexNameProcessor})
member.summary: Point documents to the right time-based index based on a date or timestamp field in a document by using the date math index name support.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.DotExpander``1(System.Func{Nest.DotExpanderProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IDotExpanderProcessor})
member.summary: Expands a field with dots into an object field. This processor allows fields with dots in the name to be accessible by other processors in the pipeline. Otherwise these fields can’t be accessed by any processor.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.GeoIp``1(System.Func{Nest.GeoIpProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IGeoIpProcessor})
member.summary: Adds information about the geographical location of IP addresses, based on data from the Maxmind databases. This processor adds this information by default under the geoip field. The geoip processor can resolve both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
member.remarks: Requires the Ingest Geoip Processor Plugin to be installed on the cluster.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.Script(System.Func{Nest.ScriptProcessorDescriptor,Nest.IScriptProcessor})
member.summary: Allows inline, stored, and file scripts to be executed within ingest pipelines.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.Sort``1(System.Func{Nest.SortProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.ISortProcessor})
member.summary: The Sort processor sorts the elements of an array ascending or descending. Homogeneous arrays of numbers will be sorted numerically, while arrays of strings or heterogeneous arrays of strings and numbers will be sorted lexicographically.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.Json``1(System.Func{Nest.JsonProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IJsonProcessor})
member.summary: Converts a JSON string into a structured JSON object.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.UserAgent``1(System.Func{Nest.UserAgentProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IUserAgentProcessor})
member.summary: The user_agent processor extracts details from the user agent string a browser sends with its web requests. This processor adds this information by default under the user_agent field. The ingest-user-agent plugin ships by default with the regexes.yaml made available by uap-java with an Apache 2.0 license.
member.remarks: Requires the UserAgent Processor Plugin to be installed on the cluster.

member.summary: URL-decodes a string

member.name: T:Nest.IBytesProcessor
member.summary: Converts a human readable byte value (e.g. 1kb) to its value in bytes (e.g. 1024). Supported human readable units are "b", "kb", "mb", "gb", "tb", "pb" case insensitive. An error will occur if the field is not a supported format or resultant value exceeds 2^63.

member.name: T:Nest.IDissectProcessor
member.summary: Similar to the Grok Processor, dissect also extracts structured fields out of a single text field within a document. However unlike the Grok Processor, dissect does not use Regular Expressions. This allows dissect’s syntax to be simple and, for some cases faster, than the Grok Processor.

member.name: T:Nest.IForeachProcessor
member.summary: Processes elements in an array of unknown length. All processors can operate on elements inside an array, but if all elements of an array need to be processed in the same way, defining a processor for each element becomes cumbersome and tricky because it is likely that the number of elements in an array is unknown. For this reason the foreach processor exists. By specifying the field holding array elements and a processor that defines what should happen to each element, array fields can easily be preprocessed.

member.name: P:Nest.IForeachProcessor.Field
member.summary: The array field

member.name: P:Nest.IForeachProcessor.Processor
member.summary: The processor to execute against each field

member.name: P:Nest.IForeachProcessor.IgnoreMissing
member.summary: If true and does not exist or is null, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document. Default is false

member.summary: The array field

member.summary: The processor to execute against each field

member.summary: If true and does not exist or is null, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document. Default is false

member.summary: The array field

member.name: T:Nest.IAttachmentProcessor
member.summary: The ingest attachment plugin lets Elasticsearch extract file attachments in common formats (such as PPT, XLS, and PDF) by using the Apache text extraction library Tika. You can use the ingest attachment plugin as a replacement for the mapper attachment plugin.
member.remarks: Requires the Ingest Attachment Processor Plugin to be installed on the cluster.

member.name: T:Nest.IGeoIpProcessor
member.summary: The GeoIP processor adds information about the geographical location of IP addresses, based on data from the Maxmind databases. This processor adds this information by default under the geoip field. The geoip processor can resolve both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
member.remarks: Requires the Ingest Geoip Processor Plugin to be installed on the cluster.

member.name: T:Nest.IUserAgentProcessor
member.summary: The user_agent processor extracts details from the user agent string a browser sends with its web requests. This processor adds this information by default under the user_agent field. The ingest-user-agent plugin ships by default with the regexes.yaml made available by uap-java with an Apache 2.0 license.
member.remarks: Requires the UserAgent Processor Plugin to be installed on the cluster.

member.summary: Maps a property as a geo_shape field

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.DistanceErrorPercentage
member.summary: Used as a hint to the Prefix about how precise it should be. Defaults to 0.025 (2.5%) with 0.5 as the maximum supported value.
member.remarks: NOTE: This value will default to 0 if a or definition is explicitly defined. This guarantees spatial precision at the level defined in the mapping. This can lead to significant memory usage for high resolution shapes with low error (e.g. large shapes at 1m with < 0.001 error). To improve indexing performance (at the cost of query accuracy) explicitly define or along with a reasonable , noting that large shapes will have greater false positives.

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.IgnoreMalformed
member.summary: If true, malformed geojson shapes are ignored. If false (default), malformed geojson shapes throw an exception and reject the whole document.
member.remarks: Valid for Elasticsearch 6.1.0+

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.IgnoreZValue
member.summary: If true (default) three dimension points will be accepted (stored in source) but only latitude and longitude values will be indexed; the third dimension is ignored. If false, geo-points containing any more than latitude and longitude (two dimensions) values throw an exception and reject the whole document.
member.remarks: Valid for Elasticsearch 6.3.0+

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.Orientation
member.summary: Defines how to interpret vertex order for polygons and multipolygons. Defaults to

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.PointsOnly
member.summary: Configures the geo_shape field type for point shapes only. Defaults to false. This optimizes index and search performance for the geohash and quadtree when it is known that only points will be indexed. At present geo_shape queries can not be executed on geo_point field types. This option bridges the gap by improving point performance on a geo_shape field so that geo_shape queries are optimal on a point only field.

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.Precision
member.summary: Used instead of to set an appropriate value for the parameter. The value specifies the desired precision and Elasticsearch will calculate the best tree_levels value to honor this precision.

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.Strategy
member.summary: Defines the approach for how to represent shapes at indexing and search time. It also influences the capabilities available so it is recommended to let Elasticsearch set this parameter automatically.

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.Tree
member.summary: Name of the PrefixTree implementation to be used. Defaults to

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.TreeLevels
member.summary: Maximum number of layers to be used by the Prefix. This can be used to control the precision of shape representations and therefore how many terms are indexed. Defaults to the default value of the chosen Prefix implementation. Since this parameter requires a certain level of understanding of the underlying implementation, users may use the parameter instead.

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoShapeProperty.Coerce
member.summary: Should the data be coerced into becoming a valid geo shape (for instance closing a polygon)

member.name: P:Nest.GeoShapeProperty.DistanceErrorPercentage
member.summary: Used as a hint to the Prefix about how precise it should be. Defaults to 0.025 (2.5%) with 0.5 as the maximum supported value.
member.remarks: NOTE: This value will default to 0 if a or definition is explicitly defined. This guarantees spatial precision at the level defined in the mapping. This can lead to significant memory usage for high resolution shapes with low error (e.g. large shapes at 1m with < 0.001 error). To improve indexing performance (at the cost of query accuracy) explicitly define or along with a reasonable , noting that large shapes will have greater false positives.

member.name: P:Nest.GeoShapeProperty.IgnoreMalformed
member.summary: If true, malformed geojson shapes are ignored. If false (default), malformed geojson shapes throw an exception and reject the whole document.
member.remarks: Valid for Elasticsearch 6.1.0+

member.name: P:Nest.GeoShapeProperty.IgnoreZValue
member.summary: If true (default) three dimension points will be accepted (stored in source) but only latitude and longitude values will be indexed; the third dimension is ignored. If false, geo-points containing any more than latitude and longitude (two dimensions) values throw an exception and reject the whole document.
member.remarks: Valid for Elasticsearch 6.3.0+

member.name: T:Nest.IClusterModuleSettings
member.summary: Settings to control where, when, and how shards are allocated to nodes.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.HighWatermark
member.summary: Controls the high watermark. It defaults to 90%, meaning ES will attempt to relocate shards to another node if the node disk usage rises above 90%. It can also be set to an absolute byte value (similar to the low watermark) to relocate shards once less than the configured amount of space is available on the node.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.IncludeRelocations
member.summary: Defaults to true, which means that Elasticsearch will take into account shards that are currently being relocated to the target node when computing a node’s disk usage. Taking relocating shards' sizes into account may, however, mean that the disk usage for a node is incorrectly estimated on the high side, since the relocation could be 90% complete and a recently retrieved disk usage would include the total size of the relocating shard as well as the space already used by the running relocation.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.LowWatermark
member.summary: Controls the low watermark for disk usage. It defaults to 85%, meaning ES will not allocate new shards to nodes once they have more than 85% disk used. It can also be set to an absolute byte value (like 500mb) to prevent ES from allocating shards if less than the configured amount of space is available.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.ThresholdEnabled
member.summary: Defaults to true. Set to false to disable the disk allocation decider.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.UpdateInterval
member.summary: How often Elasticsearch should check on disk usage for each node in the cluster. Defaults to 30s.

member.name: P:Nest.DiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.HighWatermark
member.summary: Controls the high watermark. It defaults to 90%, meaning ES will attempt to relocate shards to another node if the node disk usage rises above 90%. It can also be set to an absolute byte value (similar to the low watermark) to relocate shards once less than the configured amount of space is available on the node.

member.name: P:Nest.DiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.IncludeRelocations

Taking relocating shards' sizes into account may, however, mean that the disk usage for a node is incorrectly estimated on the high side, since the relocation could be 90% complete and a recently retrieved disk usage would include the total size of the relocating shard as well as the space already used by the running relocation.

member.summary: Allows shard allocation only for primary shards.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardAllocationSettings.AllocationEnable
member.summary: Enable or disable allocation for specific kinds of shards, defaults to all

member.name: P:Nest.IShardAllocationSettings.NodeConcurrentRecoveries
member.summary: How many concurrent shard recoveries are allowed to happen on a node. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardAllocationSettings.NodeInitialPrimariesRecoveries
member.summary: While the recovery of replicas happens over the network, the recovery of an unassigned primary after node restart uses data from the local disk. These should be fast so more initial primary recoveries can happen in parallel on the same node. Defaults to 4.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardAllocationSettings.SameShardHost
member.summary: Allows to perform a check to prevent allocation of multiple instances of the same shard on a single host, based on host name and host address. Defaults to false, meaning that no check is performed by default. This setting only applies if multiple nodes are started on the same machine.

member.summary: While the recovery of replicas happens over the network, the recovery of an unassigned primary after node restart uses data from the local disk. These should be fast so more initial primary recoveries can happen in parallel on the same node. Defaults to 4.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardBalancingHeuristicsSettings.BalanceIndex
member.summary: Defines a factor to the number of shards per index allocated on a specific node (float). Defaults to 0.55f. Raising this raises the tendency to equalize the number of shards per index across all nodes in the cluster.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardBalancingHeuristicsSettings.BalanceShard
member.summary: Defines the weight factor for shards allocated on a node (float). Defaults to 0.45f. Raising this raises the tendency to equalize the number of shards across all nodes in the cluster.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardBalancingHeuristicsSettings.BalanceThreshold
member.summary: Minimal optimization value of operations that should be performed (non negative float). Defaults to 1.0f. Raising this will cause the cluster to be less aggressive about optimizing the shard balance

member.name: P:Nest.ShardBalancingHeuristicsSettings.BalanceIndex
member.summary: Defines a factor to the number of shards per index allocated on a specific node (float). Defaults to 0.55f. Raising this raises the tendency to equalize the number of shards per index across all nodes in the cluster.

member.name: T:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings
member.summary:
The indexing buffer is used to store newly indexed documents. When it fills up, the documents in the buffer are written to a segment on disk. It is divided between all shards on the node.
The following settings are static and must be configured on every data node in the cluster

member.name: P:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings.IndexBufferSize
member.summary: Accepts either a percentage or a byte size value. It defaults to 10%, meaning that 10% of the total heap allocated to a node will be used as the indexing buffer size.

member.name: P:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings.IndexBufferSizeMaximum
member.summary: If the index_buffer_size is specified as a percentage, then this setting can be used to specify an absolute maximum. Defaults to unbounded.

member.name: P:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings.IndexBufferSizeMinimum
member.summary: If the index_buffer_size is specified as a percentage, then this setting can be used to specify an absolute minimum. Defaults to 48mb.

member.name: P:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings.ShardBufferSizeMinimum
member.summary: Sets a hard lower limit for the memory allocated per shard for its own indexing buffer. Defaults to 4mb.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.BasePath
member.summary: Specifies the path within bucket to repository data. Defaults to value of repositories.s3.base_path or to root directory if not set.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.Bucket
member.summary: The name of the bucket to be used for snapshots. This field is required

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.BufferSize
member.summary: Minimum threshold below which the chunk is uploaded using a single request. Beyond this threshold, the S3 repository will use the AWS Multipart Upload API to split the chunk into several parts, each of buffer_size length, and to upload each part in its own request. Note that setting a buffer size lower than 5mb is not allowed since it will prevent the use of the Multipart API and may result in upload errors. It is also not possible to set a buffer size greater than 5gb as it is the maximum upload size allowed by S3. Defaults to the minimum between 100mb and 5% of the heap size.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.CannedAcl
member.summary: Specify a canned ACL for the S3 bucket. The S3 repository supports all S3 canned ACLs : private, public-read, public-read-write, authenticated-read, log-delivery-write, bucket-owner-read, bucket-owner-full-control. Defaults to private.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.ChunkSize
member.summary: Big files can be broken down into chunks during snapshotting if needed. The chunk size can be specified in bytes or by using size value notation, i.e. 1gb, 10mb, 5kb. Defaults to 1gb.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.Client
member.summary: The name of the s3 client to use to connect to S3. Defaults to default.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.Compress
member.summary: When set to true metadata files are stored in compressed format. This setting doesn't affect index files that are already compressed by default. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.ServerSideEncryption
member.summary: When set to true files are encrypted on server side using AES256 algorithm. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.StorageClass
member.summary: Sets the S3 storage class type for the backup files. Values may be standard, reduced_redundancy, standard_ia. Defaults to standard.

member.name: T:Nest.IRestoreRequest
member.summary: Restores a snapshot

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.IgnoreIndexSettings
member.summary: The index settings to ignore as part of the restore operation

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.IgnoreUnavailable
member.summary: Whether indices specified that do not exist should be ignored.

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.IncludeAliases
member.summary: Whether to include aliases as part of the restore

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.IncludeGlobalState
member.summary: Whether the cluster global state should be included

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.IndexSettings
member.summary: The index settings that should be applied as part of the restore operation. Some settings cannot be changed as part of a restore operation, for example, the number of shards.

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.Indices
member.summary: The indices to restore

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.Partial
member.summary:
Allow partial restore for indices that don't have snapshots of all shards available.
By default, the entire restore operation will fail if one or more indices participating in the operation don’t have snapshots of all shards available. It can occur if some shards failed to snapshot for example. It is still possible to restore such indices by setting to true. Only successfully snapshotted shards will be restored in this case and all missing shards will be recreated empty.

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.RenamePattern
member.summary: A pattern to use to rename restored indices. The pattern can be used to capture parts of the original index name and used within

member.summary: The indices to restore

member.name: P:Nest.RestoreRequest.Partial
member.summary:
Allow partial restore for indices that don't have snapshots of all shards available.
By default, the entire restore operation will fail if one or more indices participating in the operation don’t have snapshots of all shards available. It can occur if some shards failed to snapshot for example. It is still possible to restore such indices by setting to true. Only successfully snapshotted shards will be restored in this case and all missing shards will be recreated empty.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Fuzzy(System.Func{Nest.FuzzyQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IFuzzyQuery})
member.summary: A fuzzy based query that uses similarity based on Levenshtein (edit distance) algorithm. Warning: this query is not very scalable with its default prefix length of 0 � in this case, every term will be enumerated and cause an edit score calculation or max_expansions is not set.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Match(System.Func{Nest.MatchQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IMatchQuery})
member.summary: The default match query is of type boolean. It means that the text provided is analyzed and the analysis process constructs a boolean query from the provided text.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.MatchPhrase(System.Func{Nest.MatchPhraseQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IMatchPhraseQuery})
member.summary: The match_phrase query analyzes the match and creates a phrase query out of the analyzed text.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.MatchPhrasePrefix(System.Func{Nest.MatchPhrasePrefixQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IMatchPhrasePrefixQuery})
member.summary: The match_phrase_prefix is the same as match_phrase, expect it allows for prefix matches on the last term in the text

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.MultiMatch(System.Func{Nest.MultiMatchQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IMultiMatchQuery})
member.summary: The multi_match query builds further on top of the match query by allowing multiple fields to be specified. The idea here is to allow to more easily build a concise match type query over multiple fields instead of using a relatively more expressive query by using multiple match queries within a bool query.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Nested(System.Func{Nest.NestedQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.INestedQuery})
member.summary: Nested query allows to query nested objects / docs (see nested mapping). The query is executed against the nested objects / docs as if they were indexed as separate docs (they are, internally) and resulting in the root parent doc (or parent nested mapping).

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Conditionless(System.Func{Nest.ConditionlessQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IConditionlessQuery})
member.summary: A thin wrapper allowing fined grained control what should happen if a query is conditionless if you need to fallback to something other than a match_all query

member.summary: More like this query find documents that are �like� provided text by running it against one or more fields.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Wildcard(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Double},Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite,System.String)
member.summary: Matches documents that have fields matching a wildcard expression (not analyzed). Supported wildcards are *, which matches any character sequence (including the empty one), and ?, which matches any single character. Note this query can be slow, as it needs to iterate over many terms. In order to prevent extremely slow wildcard queries, a wildcard term should not start with one of the wildcards * or ?. The wildcard query maps to Lucene WildcardQuery.

The wildcard query maps to Lucene WildcardQuery.

member.summary: Matches spans which are near one another. One can specify slop, the maximum number of intervening unmatched positions, as well as whether matches are required to be in-order. The span near query maps to Lucene SpanNearQuery.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanOr(System.Func{Nest.SpanOrQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanOrQuery})
member.summary: Matches the union of its span clauses. The span or query maps to Lucene SpanOrQuery.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanNot(System.Func{Nest.SpanNotQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanNotQuery})

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanMultiTerm(System.Func{Nest.SpanMultiTermQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanMultiTermQuery})
member.summary: Wrap a multi term query (one of fuzzy, prefix, term range or regexp query) as a span query so it can be nested.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanContaining(System.Func{Nest.SpanContainingQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanContainingQuery})
member.summary: Returns matches which enclose another span query. The span containing query maps to Lucene SpanContainingQuery

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanWithin(System.Func{Nest.SpanWithinQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanWithinQuery})
member.summary: Returns Matches which are enclosed inside another span query. The span within query maps to Lucene SpanWithinQuery

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanFieldMasking(System.Func{Nest.SpanFieldMaskingQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanFieldMaskingQuery})
member.summary: Wraps span queries to allow them to participate in composite single-field Span queries by 'lying' about their search field. That is, the masked span query will function as normal, but the field points back to the set field of the query. This can be used to support queries like SpanNearQuery or SpanOrQuery across different fields, which is not ordinarily permitted.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Regexp(System.Func{Nest.RegexpQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IRegexpQuery})
member.summary: Allows you to use regular expression term queries. "term queries" means that Elasticsearch will apply the regexp to the terms produced by the tokenizer for that field, and not to the original text of the field.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.FunctionScore(System.Func{Nest.FunctionScoreQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IFunctionScoreQuery})
member.summary: The function_score query allows you to modify the score of documents that are retrieved by a query. This can be useful if, for example, a score function is computationally expensive and it is sufficient to compute the score on a filtered set of documents.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Percolate(System.Func{Nest.PercolateQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IPercolateQuery})
member.summary: Used to match queries stored in an index. The percolate query itself contains the document that will be used as query to match with the stored queries.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.ParentId(System.Func{Nest.ParentIdQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IParentIdQuery})
member.summary: Used to find child documents which belong to a particular parent.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.TermsSet(System.Func{Nest.TermsSetQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ITermsSetQuery})
member.summary: Returns any documents that match with at least one or more of the provided terms. The terms are not analyzed and thus must match exactly. The number of terms that must match varies per document and is either controlled by a minimum should match field or computed per document in a minimum should match script.

member.name: M:Nest.BoolQueryAndExtensions.TryHandleUnmergableBools(Nest.QueryContainer,Nest.QueryContainer,Nest.IBoolQuery,Nest.IBoolQuery,Nest.QueryContainer@)
member.summary: Handles cases where either side is a bool which indicates it can't be merged yet the other side is mergable. A side is considered unmergable if its locked (has important metadata) or has should clauses. Instead of always wrapping these cases in another bool we merge to unmergable side into to others must clause therefor flattening the generated graph

member.name: M:Nest.BoolQueryAndExtensions.TryHandleBoolsWithOnlyShouldClauses(Nest.QueryContainer,Nest.QueryContainer,Nest.IBoolQuery,Nest.IBoolQuery,Nest.QueryContainer@)
member.summary: Both Sides are bools, but one of them has only should clauses so we should wrap into a new container. Unless we know one of the sides is a bool with only a must who's clauses are all bools with only shoulds. This is a piece of metadata we set at the bools creation time so we do not have to itterate the clauses on each combination In this case we can optimize the generated graph by merging and preventing stack overflows

member.name: P:Nest.IQuery.Boost
member.summary: Provides a boost to this query to influence its relevance score. For example, a query with a boost of 2 is twice as important as a query with a boost of 1, although the actual boost value that is applied undergoes normalization and internal optimization.
member.remarks: Setting a boost for an query will throw a parsing exception on the server.

member.name: P:Nest.IQuery.Conditionless
member.summary: Whether the query is conditionless. A conditionless query is not serialized as part of the request sent to Elasticsearch.

member.name: P:Nest.IQuery.IsStrict
member.summary: Whether the query should be treated as strict. A strict query will throw an exception when serialized if it is .

member.name: P:Nest.IQuery.IsVerbatim
member.summary: Whether the query should be treated as verbatim. A verbatim query will be serialized as part of the request, irrespective of whether it is or not.

member.name: P:Nest.IQuery.IsWritable
member.summary: Whether the query should be treated as writable. Used when determining how to combine queries.

member.summary: A match query for a single field

member.summary: The analyzer name used to analyze the query

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.CutoffFrequency
member.summary: A cutoff frequency that allows specifying an absolute or relative document frequency where high frequency terms are moved into an optional subquery and are only scored if one of the low frequency (below the cutoff) terms in the case of , or all of the low frequency terms in the case of an match.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.Fuzziness
member.summary: Allows fuzzy matching based on the type of field being queried.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.FuzzyRewrite
member.summary: Controls how the query is rewritten if is set. In this scenario, the default is .

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.FuzzyTranspositions
member.summary:
Sets whether transpositions are supported in fuzzy queries.
The default metric used by fuzzy queries to determine a match is the Damerau-Levenshtein distance formula which supports transpositions. Setting transposition to false will switch to classic Levenshtein distance. If not set, Damerau-Levenshtein distance metric will be used.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.Lenient
member.summary: If set to true will cause format based failures (like providing text to a numeric field) to be ignored

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.MaxExpansions
member.summary: Controls the number of terms fuzzy queries will expand to. Defaults to 50

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.MinimumShouldMatch
member.summary: A value controlling how many "should" clauses in the resulting boolean query should match. It can be an absolute value, a percentage or a combination of both.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.Operator
member.summary: The operator used if no explicit operator is specified. The default operator is

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.PrefixLength
member.summary: Set the prefix length for fuzzy queries. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.Query
member.summary: The query to execute

member.summary: The analyzer name used to analyze the query

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.AnalyzeWildcard
member.summary: By default, wildcards terms in a query are not analyzed. By setting this value to true, a best effort will be made to analyze those as well.

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.DefaultField
member.summary: The default field for query terms if no prefix field is specified. Defaults to the index.query.default_field index settings, which in turn defaults to *. * extracts all fields in the mapping that are eligible to term queries and filters the metadata fields. All extracted fields are then combined to build a query when no prefix field is provided.

member.summary: The default operator used if no explicit operator is specified. The default operator is

member.summary: Set the fuzziness for fuzzy queries. Defaults to

Sets whether transpositions are supported in fuzzy queries.
The default metric used by fuzzy queries to determine a match is the Damerau-Levenshtein distance formula which supports transpositions. Setting transposition to false will switch to classic Levenshtein distance. If not set, Damerau-Levenshtein distance metric will be used.

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.Lenient
member.summary: If set to true will cause format based failures (like providing text to a numeric field) to be ignored

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.MaximumDeterminizedStates
member.summary: Limit on how many automaton states regexp queries are allowed to create. This protects against too-difficult (e.g. exponentially hard) regexps. Defaults to 10000.

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.MinimumShouldMatch
member.summary: A value controlling how many "should" clauses in the resulting boolean query should match. It can be an absolute value, a percentage or a combination of both.

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.PhraseSlop

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchAllQuery.NormField
member.summary: When indexing, a boost value can either be associated on the document level, or per field. The match all query does not take boosting into account by default. In order to take boosting into account, the norms_field needs to be provided in order to explicitly specify which field the boosting will be done on (Note, this will result in slower execution time).

member.name: T:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm
member.summary: Multi term query rewrite method

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.ConstantScore
member.summary: A rewrite method that performs like constant_score_boolean when there are few matching terms and otherwise visits all matching terms in sequence and marks documents for that term. Matching documents are assigned a constant score equal to the query’s boost.

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.ScoringBoolean
member.summary: A rewrite method that first translates each term into a should clause in a boolean query, and keeps the scores as computed by the query. Note that typically such scores are meaningless to the user, and require non-trivial CPU to compute. This rewrite method will hit too many clauses failure if it exceeds the boolean query limit (defaults to 1024).

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.ConstantScoreBoolean
member.summary: Similar to scoring_boolean except scores are not computed. Instead, each matching document receives a constant score equal to the query’s boost. This rewrite method will hit too many clauses failure if it exceeds the boolean query limit (defaults to 1024).

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.TopTermsN
member.summary: A rewrite method that first translates each term into should clause in boolean query, and keeps the scores as computed by the query. This rewrite method only uses the top scoring terms so it will not overflow boolean max clause count. The N controls the size of the top scoring terms to use.

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.TopTermsBoostN
member.summary: A rewrite method that first translates each term into should clause in boolean query, but the scores are only computed as the boost. This rewrite method only uses the top scoring terms so it will not overflow the boolean max clause count. The N controls the size of the top scoring terms to use.

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.TopTermsBlendedFreqsN
member.summary: A rewrite method that first translates each term into should clause in boolean query, but all term queries compute scores as if they had the same frequency. In practice the frequency which is used is the maximum frequency of all matching terms. This rewrite method only uses the top scoring terms so it will not overflow boolean max clause count. The N controls the size of the top scoring terms to use.

member.name: T:Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite
member.summary: Controls how a multi term query such as a wildcard or prefix query, is rewritten.

member.name: P:Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite.ConstantScore
member.summary: A rewrite method that performs like constant_score_boolean when there are few matching terms and otherwise visits all matching terms in sequence and marks documents for that term. Matching documents are assigned a constant score equal to the query’s boost.

member.name: P:Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite.ConstantScoreBoolean
member.summary: Similar to scoring_boolean except scores are not computed. Instead, each matching document receives a constant score equal to the query’s boost. This rewrite method will hit too many clauses failure if it exceeds the boolean query limit (defaults to 1024).

member.name: P:Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite.Rewrite
member.summary: The type of multi term rewrite to perform

member.name: P:Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite.ScoringBoolean
member.summary: A rewrite method that first translates each term into a should clause in a boolean query, and keeps the scores as computed by the query. Note that typically such scores are meaningless to the user, and require non-trivial CPU to compute. This rewrite method will hit too many clauses failure if it exceeds the boolean query limit (defaults to 1024).

member.name: P:Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite.Size
member.summary: The size of the top scoring terms to use

member.name: M:Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite.TopTerms(System.Int32)
member.summary:
A rewrite method that first translates each term into should clause in boolean query, and keeps the scores as computed by the query. This rewrite method only uses the top scoring terms so it will not overflow boolean max clause count.
controls the size of the top scoring terms to use.

member.name: M:Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite.TopTermsBoost(System.Int32)
member.summary:
A rewrite method that first translates each term into should clause in boolean query, but the scores are only computed as the boost. This rewrite method only uses the top scoring terms so it will not overflow the boolean max clause count.
controls the size of the top scoring terms to use.

member.name: M:Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite.TopTermsBlendedFreqs(System.Int32)
member.summary:
A rewrite method that first translates each term into should clause in boolean query, but all term queries compute scores as if they had the same frequency. In practice the frequency which is used is the maximum frequency of all matching terms. This rewrite method only uses the top scoring terms so it will not overflow boolean max clause count.
controls the size of the top scoring terms to use.

member.name: P:Nest.IMoreLikeThisQuery.PerFieldAnalyzer
member.summary: Provide a different analyzer than the one at the field. This is useful in order to generate term vectors in any fashion, especially when using artificial documents.

member.name: P:Nest.MoreLikeThisQuery.PerFieldAnalyzer
member.summary: Provide a different analyzer than the one at the field. This is useful in order to generate term vectors in any fashion, especially when using artificial documents.

member.name: T:Nest.ITermsSetQuery
member.summary: Returns any documents that match with at least one or more of the provided terms. The terms are not analyzed and thus must match exactly. The number of terms that must match varies per document and is either controlled by a minimum should match field or computed per document in a minimum should match script.

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.IgnoreUnavailable
member.summary: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.IgnoreThrottled
member.summary: Whether specified concrete, expanded or aliased indices should be ignored when throttled

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.AllowNoIndices
member.summary: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.ExpandWildcards
member.summary: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.MinScore
member.summary: Include only documents with a specific `_score` value in the result

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.Preference
member.summary: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random)

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.Routing
member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
Elasticsearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document NEST will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.summary: Query in the Lucene query string syntax

member.summary: The analyzer to use for the query string

member.summary: Specify whether wildcard and prefix queries should be analyzed (default: false)

member.summary: The default operator for query string query (AND or OR)

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.Df
member.summary: The field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.Lenient
member.summary: Specify whether format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) should be ignored

member.name: P:Nest.CountRequest.TerminateAfter
member.summary: The maximum count for each shard, upon reaching which the query execution will terminate early

member.name: P:Nest.MultiSearchRequest.PreFilterShardSize
member.summary: A threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on it's rewrite method ie. if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

member.name: P:Nest.MultiSearchRequest.MaxConcurrentShardRequests
member.summary: The number of concurrent shard requests each sub search executes concurrently. This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests

member.summary: This parameter is ignored in this version. It is used in the next major version to control whether the rest response should render the total.hits as an object or a number

member.summary: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random)

member.name: P:Nest.SearchShardsRequest.Routing
member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
Elasticsearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document NEST will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.name: T:Nest.IFieldCollapse
member.summary:
Allows to collapse search results based on field values. The collapsing is done by selecting only the top sorted document per collapse key. For instance the query below retrieves the best tweet for each user and sorts them by number of likes.
NOTE: The collapsing is applied to the top hits only and does not affect aggregations.

member.name: P:Nest.IFieldCollapse.Field
member.summary: The field used for collapsing must be a single valued keyword or number field with doc-values activated

member.name: P:Nest.IFieldCollapse.InnerHits
member.summary: It is also possible to expand each collapsed top hits with the `inner_hits` option.

member.name: P:Nest.IFieldCollapse.MaxConcurrentGroupSearches
member.summary: The expansion of the group is done by sending an additional query for each inner_hit request for each collapsed hit returned in the response. This can significantly slow things down if you have too many groups and/or inner_hit requests. The max_concurrent_group_searches request parameter can be used to control the maximum number of concurrent searches allowed in this phase. The default is based on the number of data nodes and the default search thread pool size.

member.name: P:Nest.FieldCollapse.Field
member.summary: The field used for collapsing must be a single valued keyword or number field with doc-values activated

member.name: P:Nest.FieldCollapse.InnerHits
member.summary: It is also possible to expand each collapsed top hits with the `inner_hits` option.

member.name: P:Nest.FieldCollapse.MaxConcurrentGroupSearches
member.summary: The expansion of the group is done by sending an additional query for each inner_hit request for each collapsed hit returned in the response. This can significantly slow things down if you have too many groups and/or inner_hit requests. The max_concurrent_group_searches request parameter can be used to control the maximum number of concurrent searches allowed in this phase. The default is based on the number of data nodes and the default search thread pool size.

This can significantly slow things down if you have too many groups and/or inner_hit requests. The max_concurrent_group_searches request parameter can be used to control the maximum number of concurrent searches allowed in this phase. The default is based on the number of data nodes and the default search thread pool size.

member.name: F:Nest.BoundaryScanner.Characters
member.summary: (default mode for the FVH): allows to configure which characters (boundary_chars) constitute a boundary for highlighting. It’s a single string with each boundary character defined in it (defaults to .,!? \t\n). It also allows configuring the boundary_max_scan to control how far to look for boundary characters (defaults to 20). Works only with the Fast Vector Highlighter.

member.name: F:Nest.BoundaryScanner.Sentence
member.summary: sentence and word: use Java’s BreakIterator to break the highlighted fragments at the next sentence or word boundary. You can further specify boundary_scanner_locale to control which Locale is used to search the text for these boundaries.

member.name: F:Nest.BoundaryScanner.Word
member.summary: sentence and word: use Java’s BreakIterator to break the highlighted fragments at the next sentence or word boundary. You can further specify boundary_scanner_locale to control which Locale is used to search the text for these boundaries.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.BoundaryChars
member.summary: Defines what constitutes a boundary for highlighting when using the fast vector highlighter. It's a single string with each boundary character defined in it. It defaults to .,!? \t\n.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.BoundaryMaxScan
member.summary: Controls how far to look for boundary characters. Defaults to 20.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.BoundaryScanner
member.summary: When highlighting a field using the unified highlighter or the fast vector highlighter, you can specify how to break the highlighted fragments using boundary_scanner

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.BoundaryScannerLocale
member.summary: You can further specify boundary_scanner_locale to control which Locale is used to search the text for these boundaries.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.Encoder
member.summary: Define how highlighted text will be encoded. It can be either default (no encoding) or html (will escape html, if you use html highlighting tags).

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.Fragmenter
member.summary: Fragmenter can control how text should be broken up in highlight snippets. However, this option is applicable only for the Plain Highlighter

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.FragmentOffset
member.summary: Controls the margin to start highlighting from when using the fast vector highlighter

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.FragmentSize
member.summary: The size of the highlighted fragment, in characters. Defaults to 100

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.NoMatchSize
member.summary: In the case where there is no matching fragment to highlight, the default is to not return anything. Instead, we can return a snippet of text from the beginning of the field by setting no_match_size (default 0) to the length of the text that you want returned. The actual length may be shorter or longer than specified as it tries to break on a word boundary.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.NumberOfFragments
member.summary: The maximum number of fragments to return. Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.Order
member.summary: The order in which highlighted fragments are sorted

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.PostTags
member.summary: Controls the post tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.PreTags
member.summary: Controls the pre tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.summary: Breaks up text into same sized fragments.

member.name: F:Nest.HighlighterFragmenter.Span
member.summary: Same as the simple fragmenter, but tries not to break up text between highlighted terms (this is applicable when using phrase like queries). This is the default.

member.summary: Sorts highlighted fragments

member.name: T:Nest.HighlighterType
member.summary: Type of highlighter

member.name: F:Nest.HighlighterType.Plain
member.summary: Plain Highlighter. Uses the Lucene highlighter. It tries hard to reflect the query matching logic in terms of understanding word importance and any word positioning criteria in phrase queries.

member.name: F:Nest.HighlighterType.Fvh
member.summary: Fast Vector Highlighter. If term_vector information is provided by setting term_vector to with_positions_offsets in the mapping then the fast vector highlighter will be used instead of the plain highlighter

member.name: F:Nest.HighlighterType.Unified
member.summary: Unified Highlighter. The default choice. The unified highlighter can extract offsets from either term vectors, or via re-analyzing text. Under the hood it uses Lucene UnifiedHighlighter which picks its strategy depending on the field and the query to highlight. Independently of the strategy this highlighter breaks the text into sentences and scores individual sentences as if they were documents in this corpus, using the BM25 algorithm. It supports accurate phrase and multi-term (fuzzy, prefix, regex) highlighting

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.BoundaryChars
member.summary: Defines what constitutes a boundary for highlighting when using the fast vector highlighter. It's a single string with each boundary character defined in it. It defaults to .,!? \t\n.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.BoundaryMaxScan
member.summary: Controls how far to look for boundary characters. Defaults to 20.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.BoundaryScanner
member.summary: When highlighting a field using the unified highlighter or the fast vector highlighter, you can specify how to break the highlighted fragments using boundary_scanner

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.BoundaryScannerLocale
member.summary: You can further specify boundary_scanner_locale to control which Locale is used to search the text for these boundaries.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.Field
member.summary: The field on which to perform highlighting.
member.remarks: In order to perform highlighting, the actual content of the field is required. If the field in question is stored (has store set to true in the mapping) it will be used, otherwise, the actual _source will be loaded and the relevant field will be extracted from it.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.ForceSource
member.summary: Forces the highlighting to highlight fields based on the source even if fields are stored separately.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.Fragmenter
member.summary: Fragmenter can control how text should be broken up in highlight snippets. However, this option is applicable only for the Plain Highlighter

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.FragmentOffset
member.summary: Controls the margin to start highlighting from when using the fast vector highlighter

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.FragmentSize
member.summary: The size of the highlighted fragment, in characters. Defaults to 100

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.HighlightQuery
member.summary: The query to use for highlighting

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.MatchedFields
member.summary: Combine matches on multiple fields to highlight a single field when using the fast vector highighter. This is most intuitive for multifields that analyze the same string in different ways. All matched fields must have term_vector set to with_positions_offsets, but only the field to which the matches are combined is loaded so only that field would benefit from having store set to yes.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.NoMatchSize
member.summary: The length of a snippet of text from the beginning of the field to return when no match for highlighting is found. Default behaviour is to not return anything when a match is not found. The actual length may be shorter than specified as it tries to break on a word boundary.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.NumberOfFragments
member.summary: The maximum number of fragments to return. Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.Order
member.summary: The order in which highlighted fragments are sorted. Only valid for the unified highlighter.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.PhraseLimit
member.summary: Controls the number of matching phrases in a document that are considered. Prevents the highlighter from analyzing too many phrases and consuming too much memory. When using matched_fields, phrases per matched field are considered. Raising the limit increases query time and consumes more memory. Only supported by the highlighter. Defaults to 256.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.PostTags
member.summary: Controls the post tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.PreTags
member.summary: Controls the pre tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.RequireFieldMatch
member.summary: Determines if only fields that hold a query match will be highlighted. Set to false will cause any field to be highlighted regardless of whether the query matched specifically on them. Default behaviour is true.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.TagsSchema
member.summary: Use a specific "tag" schemas.
member.remarks: Currently a single schema called "styled" with the following pre_tags: <em class="hlt1">, <em class="hlt2">, <em class="hlt3">, <em class="hlt4">, <em class="hlt5">, <em class="hlt6">, <em class="hlt7">, <em class="hlt8">, <em class="hlt9">, <em class="hlt10">

member.summary: The analyzer to use for the query string

member.summary: Specify whether wildcard and prefix queries should be analyzed (default: false)

member.summary: The default operator for query string query (AND or OR)

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.Df
member.summary: The field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.IgnoreUnavailable
member.summary: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.IgnoreThrottled
member.summary: Whether specified concrete, expanded or aliased indices should be ignored when throttled

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.AllowNoIndices
member.summary: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.ExpandWildcards
member.summary: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.Lenient
member.summary: Specify whether format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) should be ignored

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.Preference
member.summary: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random)

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.Routing
member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
Elasticsearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document NEST will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.Scroll
member.summary: Specify how long a consistent view of the index should be maintained for scrolled search

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.SearchType
member.summary: Search operation type

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.Stats
member.summary: Specific 'tag' of the request for logging and statistical purposes

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.SuggestField
member.summary: Specify which field to use for suggestions

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.SuggestMode
member.summary: Specify suggest mode

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.SuggestSize
member.summary: How many suggestions to return in response

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.SuggestText
member.summary: The source text for which the suggestions should be returned

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.TrackTotalHits
member.summary: Indicate if the number of documents that match the query should be tracked

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.AllowPartialSearchResults
member.summary: Indicate if an error should be returned if there is a partial search failure or timeout

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.TypedKeys
member.summary: Specify whether aggregation and suggester names should be prefixed by their respective types in the response

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.SeqNoPrimaryTerm
member.summary: Specify whether to return sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.RequestCache
member.summary: Specify if request cache should be used for this request or not, defaults to index level setting

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.BatchedReduceSize
member.summary: The number of shard results that should be reduced at once on the coordinating node. This value should be used as a protection mechanism to reduce the memory overhead per search request if the potential number of shards in the request can be large.

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.MaxConcurrentShardRequests
member.summary: The number of concurrent shard requests this search executes concurrently. This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.PreFilterShardSize
member.summary: A threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on it's rewrite method ie. if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.TotalHitsAsInteger
member.summary: This parameter is ignored in this version. It is used in the next major version to control whether the rest response should render the total.hits as an object or a number
