member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.Lenient
member.summary: Specify whether format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) should be ignored

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.Preference
member.summary: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random)

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.Routing
member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
Elasticsearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document NEST will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.Scroll
member.summary: Specify how long a consistent view of the index should be maintained for scrolled search

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.SearchType
member.summary: Search operation type

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.Stats
member.summary: Specific 'tag' of the request for logging and statistical purposes

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.SuggestField
member.summary: Specify which field to use for suggestions

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.SuggestMode
member.summary: Specify suggest mode

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.SuggestSize
member.summary: How many suggestions to return in response

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.SuggestText
member.summary: The source text for which the suggestions should be returned

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.TrackTotalHits
member.summary: Indicate if the number of documents that match the query should be tracked

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.AllowPartialSearchResults
member.summary: Indicate if an error should be returned if there is a partial search failure or timeout

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.TypedKeys
member.summary: Specify whether aggregation and suggester names should be prefixed by their respective types in the response

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.SeqNoPrimaryTerm
member.summary: Specify whether to return sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.RequestCache
member.summary: Specify if request cache should be used for this request or not, defaults to index level setting

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.BatchedReduceSize
member.summary: The number of shard results that should be reduced at once on the coordinating node. This value should be used as a protection mechanism to reduce the memory overhead per search request if the potential number of shards in the request can be large.

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.MaxConcurrentShardRequests
member.summary: The number of concurrent shard requests this search executes concurrently. This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.PreFilterShardSize
member.summary: A threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on it's rewrite method ie. if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest`1.TotalHitsAsInteger
member.summary: This parameter is ignored in this version. It is used in the next major version to control whether the rest response should render the total.hits as an object or a number

member.summary: The number of hits to return. Defaults to 10.

member.summary: The number of hits to return. Alias for . Defaults to 10.

member.summary: The starting from index of the hits to return. Defaults to 0.

member.summary: Enables explanation for each hit on how its score was computed. (Use .DocumentsWithMetadata on the return results)

member.name: M:Nest.SearchDescriptor`1.Version(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Returns a version for each search hit. (Use .DocumentsWithMetadata on the return results)

member.name: M:Nest.SearchDescriptor`1.TrackScores(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Make sure we keep calculating score even if we are sorting on a field.

member.name: M:Nest.SearchDescriptor`1.Profile(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: The Profile API provides detailed timing information about the execution of individual components in a query. It gives the user insight into how queries are executed at a low level so that the user can understand why certain queries are slow, and take steps to improve their slow queries.

member.name: M:Nest.SearchDescriptor`1.MinScore(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Allows to filter out documents based on a minimum score:

member.name: M:Nest.SearchDescriptor`1.TerminateAfter(System.Nullable{System.Int64})
member.summary: The maximum number of documents to collect for each shard, upon reaching which the query execution will terminate early. If set, the response will have a boolean field terminated_early to indicate whether the query execution has actually terminated_early.

summary.para: Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
The operation will go and be executed only on the primary shards.
Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
The operation will go and be executed on the primary shard, and if not available (failover), will execute on other shards.
Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
The operation will prefer to be executed on a local allocated shard is possible.
Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
Restricts the search to execute only on a node with the provided node id
Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
Prefers execution on the node with the provided node id if applicable.

member.name: M:Nest.SearchDescriptor`1.Collapse(System.Func{Nest.FieldCollapseDescriptor{`0},Nest.IFieldCollapse})
member.summary:
Allows to collapse search results based on field values. The collapsing is done by selecting only the top sorted document per collapse key. For instance the query below retrieves the best tweet for each user and sorts them by number of likes.
NOTE: The collapsing is applied to the top hits only and does not affect aggregations. You can only collapse to a depth of 2.

member.name: T:Nest.SortMode
member.summary: Elasticsearch supports sorting by array or multi-valued fields. The mode option controls what array value is picked for sorting the document it belongs to.

member.name: F:Nest.SortMode.Min
member.summary: Pick the lowest value.

member.name: F:Nest.SortMode.Max
member.summary: Pick the highest value.

member.name: F:Nest.SortMode.Sum
member.summary: Use the sum of all values as sort value. Only applicable for number based array fields.

member.name: F:Nest.SortMode.Average
member.summary: Use the average of all values as sort value. Only applicable for number based array fields.

member.name: F:Nest.SortMode.Median
member.summary: Use the median of all values as sort value. Only applicable for number based array fields.

member.summary: Controls if all phrase suggestions will be returned. When set to true, the suggestions will have an additional option collate_match, which will be true if matching documents for the phrase was found, false otherwise. The default value for is false.

member.summary: The term suggester suggests terms based on edit distance. The provided suggest text is analyzed before terms are suggested. The suggested terms are provided per analyzed suggest text token. The term suggester doesn’t take the query into account that is part of request.

member.name: M:Nest.SuggestContainerDescriptor`1.Phrase(System.String,System.Func{Nest.PhraseSuggesterDescriptor{`0},Nest.IPhraseSuggester})
member.summary: The phrase suggester adds additional logic on top of the term suggester to select entire corrected phrases instead of individual tokens weighted based on ngram-langugage models.

member.name: M:Nest.SuggestContainerDescriptor`1.Completion(System.String,System.Func{Nest.CompletionSuggesterDescriptor{`0},Nest.ICompletionSuggester})
member.summary: The completion suggester is a so-called prefix suggester. It does not do spell correction like the term or phrase suggesters but allows basic auto-complete functionality.

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.RemoteCluster
member.summary: the remote cluster containing the leader indices to match against

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.LeaderIndexPatterns
member.summary: an array of simple index patterns to match against indices in the remote cluster specified by the remote_cluster field

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.FollowIndexPattern
member.summary: the name of follower index; the template {{leader_index}} can be used to derive the name of the follower index from the name of the leader index

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxReadRequestOperationCount
member.summary: the maximum number of operations to pull per read from the remote cluster

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxOutstandingReadRequests
member.summary: the maximum number of outstanding reads requests from the remote cluster

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxReadRequestSize
member.summary: the maximum size in bytes of per read of a batch of operations pulled from the remote cluster

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxWriteRequestOperationCount
member.summary: the maximum number of operations per bulk write request executed on the follower

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxWriteRequestSize
member.summary: the maximum total bytes of operations per bulk write request executed on the follower

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxOutstandingWriteRequests
member.summary: the maximum number of outstanding write requests on the follower

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxWriteBufferCount
member.summary: the maximum number of operations that can be queued for writing; when this limit is reached, reads from the remote cluster will be deferred until the number of queued operations goes below the limit

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxWriteBufferSize
member.summary: the maximum total bytes of operations that can be queued for writing; when this limit is reached, reads from the remote cluster will be deferred until the total bytes of queued operations goes below the limit

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxRetryDelay
member.summary: the maximum time to wait before retrying an operation that failed exceptionally; an exponential backoff strategy is employed when retrying

member.name: P:Nest.IAutoFollowPattern.MaxPollTimeout
member.summary: the maximum time to wait for new operations on the remote cluster when the follower index is synchronized with the leader index; when the timeout has elapsed, the poll for operations will return to the follower so that it can update some statistics, and then the follower will immediately attempt to read from the leader again

member.summary: /{index}/{type}/_xpack/graph/_explore

member.name: P:Nest.GraphExploreRequest.Routing
member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
Elasticsearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document NEST will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.name: T:Nest.IAllocateLifecycleAction
member.summary: The Allocate action allows you to specify which nodes are allowed to host the shards of the index and set the number of replicas. Behind the scenes, it is modifying the index settings for shard filtering and/or replica counts. When updating the number of replicas, configuring allocation rules is optional. When configuring allocation rules, setting number of replicas is optional. Although this action can be treated as two separate index settings updates, both can be configured at once.

member.name: T:Nest.IFreezeLifecycleAction
member.summary: This action will freeze the index by calling the Freeze Index API. Note: Freezing an index will close the index and reopen it within the same API call. This causes primaries to not be allocated for a short amount of time and causes the cluster to go red until the primaries are allocated again. This limitation might be removed in the future.
member.remarks: Phases allowed: cold.

member.name: T:Nest.IReadOnlyLifecycleAction
member.summary: This action will set the index to be read-only.
member.remarks: Phases allowed: warm.

member.name: T:Nest.IRolloverLifecycleAction
member.summary: The Rollover Action rolls an alias over to a new index when the existing index meets one of the rollover conditions.
member.remarks: Phases allowed: hot.

member.name: T:Nest.ISetPriorityLifecycleAction
member.summary: This action sets the index priority on the index as soon as the policy enters the hot, warm, or cold phase. Indices with a higher priority will be recovered before indices with lower priorities following a node restart. Generally, indexes in the hot phase should have the highest value and indexes in the cold phase should have the lowest values. For example: 100 for the hot phase, 50 for the warm phase, and 0 for the cold phase. Indicies that don’t set this value have an implicit default priority of 1.
member.remarks: Phases allowed: hot, warm, cold.

member.name: P:Nest.ISetPriorityLifecycleAction.Priority
member.summary: The priority for the index. Must be 0 or greater. The value may also be set to null to remove the priority.

member.name: P:Nest.SetPriorityLifecycleAction.Priority
member.summary: The priority for the index. Must be 0 or greater. The value may also be set to null to remove the priority.

member.name: M:Nest.SetPriorityLifecycleActionDescriptor.Priority(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: The priority for the index. Must be 0 or greater. The value may also be set to null to remove the priority.

member.name: T:Nest.IShrinkLifecycleAction
member.summary: This action shrinks an existing index into a new index with fewer primary shards. It calls the Shrink API to shrink the index. Since allocating all the primary shards of the index to one node is a prerequisite, this action will first allocate the primary shards to a valid node. After shrinking, it will swap aliases pointing to the original index into the new shrunken index. The new index will also have a new name: "shrink-[origin-index-name]". So if the original index was called "logs", then the new index will be named "shrink-logs".

member.name: P:Nest.IShrinkLifecycleAction.NumberOfShards
member.summary: The number of shards to shrink to. must be a factor of the number of shards in the source index.

member.name: P:Nest.ShrinkLifecycleAction.NumberOfShards
member.summary: The number of shards to shrink to. must be a factor of the number of shards in the source index.

member.name: M:Nest.ShrinkLifecycleActionDescriptor.NumberOfShards(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: The number of shards to shrink to. must be a factor of the number of shards in the source index.

member.name: T:Nest.IUnfollowLifecycleAction
member.summary: This action turns a ccr follower index into a regular index. This can be desired when moving follower indices into the next phase. Also certain actions like shrink and rollover can then be performed safely on follower indices.

If the basic license does not support all of the features that are available with your current license, however, you are notified in the response. You must then re-submit the API request with the acknowledge parameter set to true.

member.name: T:Nest.IChunkingConfig
member.summary: Datafeeds might be required to search over long time periods, for several months or years. This search is split into time chunks in order to ensure the load on Elasticsearch is managed. Chunking configuration controls how the size of these time chunks are calculated.

member.name: P:Nest.IChunkingConfig.Mode
member.summary: The chunking mode

member.name: P:Nest.IChunkingConfig.TimeSpan
member.summary: The time span that each search will be querying. This setting is only applicable when is set to .

member.summary: The chunking mode

member.name: P:Nest.ChunkingConfig.TimeSpan
member.summary: The time span that each search will be querying. This setting is only applicable when is set to .

member.summary: The chunking mode

member.name: M:Nest.ChunkingConfigDescriptor.TimeSpan(Nest.Time)
member.summary: The time span that each search will be querying. This setting is only applicable when is set to .

member.name: T:Nest.ChunkingMode
member.summary: The chunking mode

member.name: F:Nest.ChunkingMode.Auto
member.summary: The chunk size will be dynamically calculated. This is the default and recommended value.

member.name: F:Nest.ChunkingMode.Manual
member.summary: Chunking will be applied according to the specified time span.

member.name: F:Nest.ChunkingMode.Off
member.summary: No chunking will be applied.

member.summary: The aggregation searches to perform for the datafeed.

member.name: P:Nest.DatafeedConfig.Frequency
member.summary: The interval at which scheduled queries are made while the datafeed runs in real time. The default value is either the bucket span for short bucket spans, or, for longer bucket spans, a sensible fraction of the bucket span.

member.name: P:Nest.DatafeedConfig.Indices
member.summary: A list of index names to search within, wildcards are supported.

member.name: P:Nest.DatafeedConfig.JobId
member.summary: A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the job.

member.name: P:Nest.DatafeedConfig.Query
member.summary: Describe the query to perform using a query descriptor lambda.

member.name: P:Nest.DatafeedConfig.QueryDelay
member.summary: The number of seconds behind real time that data is queried. For example, if data from 10:04 A.M. might not be searchable until 10:06 A.M., set this property to 120 seconds. The default value is 60s.

member.name: P:Nest.DatafeedConfig.ScriptFields
member.summary: Specifies scripts that evaluate custom expressions and returns script fields to the datafeed. The detector configuration in a job can contain functions that use these script fields.

member.name: P:Nest.DatafeedConfig.ScrollSize
member.summary: The size parameter that is used in searches.

member.name: P:Nest.DatafeedConfig.Types
member.summary: A list of types to search for within the specified indices.

member.name: T:Nest.IGetOverallBucketsRequest
member.summary: Retrieves overall bucket results that summarize the bucket results of multiple jobs.

member.name: P:Nest.IGetOverallBucketsRequest.AllowNoJobs
member.summary: If false and the job id does not match any job an error will be returned. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Nest.IGetOverallBucketsRequest.BucketSpan
member.summary: The span of the overall buckets. Must be greater or equal to the largest job’s bucket span. Defaults to the largest job’s bucket span.

member.name: P:Nest.IGetOverallBucketsRequest.End
member.summary: Returns overall buckets with timestamps earlier than this time.

member.name: P:Nest.IGetOverallBucketsRequest.ExcludeInterim
member.summary: If true, the output excludes interim overall buckets. Overall buckets are interim if any of the job buckets within the overall bucket interval are interim. By default, interim results are included.

member.name: P:Nest.IGetOverallBucketsRequest.OverallScore
member.summary: Returns overall buckets with overall scores greater or equal than this value.

member.name: P:Nest.IGetOverallBucketsRequest.Start
member.summary: Returns overall buckets with timestamps after this time.

member.name: P:Nest.IGetOverallBucketsRequest.TopN
member.summary: The number of top job bucket scores to be used in the calculation on the response. The default value is 1.

member.name: T:Nest.IAnalysisConfig
member.summary: An analysis configuration for a machine learning job.

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisConfig.BucketSpan
member.summary: The size of the interval that the analysis is aggregated into, typically between 5m and 1h. The default value is 5m.

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisConfig.CategorizationFieldName
member.summary: If this property is specified, the values of the specified field will be categorized. The resulting categories must be used in a detector by setting by_field_name, over_field_name, or partition_field_name to the keyword mlcategory

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisConfig.CategorizationFilters
member.summary: If categorization_field_name is specified, you can also define optional filters. This property expects an array of regular expressions. The expressions are used to filter out matching sequences off the categorization field values.

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisConfig.Detectors
member.summary: A collection of detectors, which describe the anomaly detectors that are used in the job.

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisConfig.Influencers
member.summary: A collection of influencer field names. Typically these can be the by, over, or partition fields that are used in the detector configuration. You might also want to use a field name that is not specifically named in a detector, but is available as part of the input data. When you use multiple detectors, the use of influencers is recommended as it aggregates results for each influencer entity.

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisConfig.Latency
member.summary: The size of the window in which to expect data that is out of time order. The default value is 0 (no latency).

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisConfig.MultivariateByFields
member.summary: If set to true, the analysis will automatically find correlations between metrics for a given by field value and report anomalies when those correlations cease to hold.

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisConfig.SummaryCountFieldName
member.summary: The name of the field that contains the count of raw data points that have been summarized, if data that is fed to the job is expected to be pre-summarized.

member.name: P:Nest.AnalysisConfig.BucketSpan
member.summary: The size of the interval that the analysis is aggregated into, typically between 5m and 1h. The default value is 5m.

member.summary: If this property is specified, the values of the specified field will be categorized. The resulting categories must be used in a detector by setting by_field_name, over_field_name, or partition_field_name to the keyword mlcategory

member.name: T:Nest.IAnalysisLimits
member.summary: Limits applied for the resources required to hold the mathematical models in memory. These limits are approximate and can be set per job. They do not control the memory used by other processes, for example the Elasticsearch Java processes. If necessary, you can increase the limits after the job is created.

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisLimits.CategorizationExamplesLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of examples stored per category in memory and in the results data store. The default value is 4. If you increase this value, more examples are available, however it requires that you have more storage available. If you set this value to 0, no examples are stored.

member.name: P:Nest.IAnalysisLimits.ModelMemoryLimit
member.summary: The approximate maximum amount of memory resources that are required for analytical processing, in MiB. Once this limit is approached, data pruning becomes more aggressive. Upon exceeding this limit, new entities are not modeled. The default value is 4096.

member.name: P:Nest.AnalysisLimits.CategorizationExamplesLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of examples stored per category in memory and in the results data store. The default value is 4. If you increase this value, more examples are available, however it requires that you have more storage available. If you set this value to 0, no examples are stored.

member.name: P:Nest.AnalysisLimits.ModelMemoryLimit
member.summary: The approximate maximum amount of memory resources that are required for analytical processing, in MiB. Once this limit is approached, data pruning becomes more aggressive. Upon exceeding this limit, new entities are not modeled. The default value is 4096.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalysisLimitsDescriptor.CategorizationExamplesLimit(System.Nullable{System.Int64})
member.summary: The maximum number of examples stored per category in memory and in the results data store. The default value is 4. If you increase this value, more examples are available, however it requires that you have more storage available. If you set this value to 0, no examples are stored.

member.summary: The approximate maximum amount of memory resources that are required for analytical processing, in MiB. Once this limit is approached, data pruning becomes more aggressive. Upon exceeding this limit, new entities are not modeled. The default value is 4096.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.AnalysisConfig
member.summary: The analysis configuration, which specifies how to analyze the data.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.AnalysisLimits
member.summary: Optionally specifies runtime limits for the job.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.BackgroundPersistInterval
member.summary: Advanced configuration option. The time between each periodic persistence of the model. The default value is a randomized value between 3 to 4 hours, which avoids all jobs persisting at exactly the same time. The smallest allowed value is 1 hour.
member.remarks: For very large models (several GB), persistence could take 10-20 minutes, so do not set the value too low.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.CreateTime
member.summary: The time the job was created.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.DataDescription
member.summary: Describes the format of the input data. This object is required, but it can be empty.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.Description
member.summary: An optional description of the job.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.FinishedTime
member.summary: If the job closed or failed, this is the time the job finished, otherwise it is null.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.JobId
member.summary: The unique identifier for the job.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.JobType
member.summary: The job type.
member.remarks: Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.ModelPlotConfig
member.summary: This advanced configuration option stores model information along with the results. This adds overhead to the performance of the system and is not feasible for jobs with many entities.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.ModelSnapshotId
member.summary: A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the model snapshot.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.ModelSnapshotRetentionDays
member.summary: The time in days that model snapshots are retained for the job. Older snapshots are deleted. The default value is 1 day.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.RenormalizationWindowDays
member.summary: Advanced configuration option. The period over which adjustments to the score are applied, as new data is seen. The default value is the longer of 30 days or 100 bucket spans.

member.name: P:Nest.Job.ResultsIndexName
member.summary: The name of the index in which to store the machine learning results. The default value is shared (which corresponds to the index name .ml-anomalies-shared).

member.name: P:Nest.Job.ResultsRetentionDays
member.summary: Advanced configuration option. The number of days for which job results are retained. Once per day at 00:30 (server time), results older than this period are deleted from Elasticsearch. The default value is null, which means results are retained.

member.name: T:Nest.JobState
member.summary: The state of a machine learning job

member.name: F:Nest.JobState.Closing
member.summary: The job close action is in progress and has not yet completed. A closing job cannot accept further data.

member.name: F:Nest.JobState.Closed
member.summary: The job finished successfully with its model state persisted. The job must be opened before it can accept further data.

member.name: F:Nest.JobState.Opened
member.summary: The job is available to receive and process data.

member.name: F:Nest.JobState.Failed
member.summary: The job did not finish successfully due to an error. This situation can occur due to invalid input data. If the job had irrevocably failed, it must be force closed and then deleted. If the datafeed can be corrected, the job can be closed and then re-opened.

member.name: F:Nest.JobState.Opening
member.summary: The job open action is in progress and has not yet completed.

member.name: F:Nest.MemoryStatus.HardLimit

member.name: T:Nest.NonZeroCountDetector
member.summary: Detects anomalies when the number of events in a bucket is anomalous, but it ignores cases where the bucket count is zero. Use this function if you know your data is sparse or has gaps and the gaps are not important.

member.name: T:Nest.HighNonZeroCountDetector
member.summary: Detects anomalies when the number of events in a bucket is unusually high and it ignores cases where the bucket count is zero.

member.name: T:Nest.LowNonZeroCountDetector
member.summary: Detects anomalies when the number of events in a bucket is unusually low and it ignores cases where the bucket count is zero.

member.name: T:Nest.IDetector
member.summary: A machine learning detector

member.name: P:Nest.IDetector.DetectorDescription
member.summary: A description of the detector. For example, "Low event rate".

member.name: P:Nest.IDetector.DetectorIndex
member.summary: A unique identifier for the detector. This identifier is based on the order of the detectors in the analysis config, starting at zero. You can use this identifier when you want to update a specific detector.

member.name: P:Nest.IDetector.ExcludeFrequent
member.summary: If set, frequent entities are excluded from influencing the anomaly results. Entities can be considered frequent over time or frequent in a population. If you are working with both over and by fields, then you can set exclude_frequent to all for both fields, or to by or over for those specific fields.

member.name: P:Nest.IDetector.Function
member.summary: The analysis function used

member.name: P:Nest.IDetector.UseNull
member.summary: Defines whether a new series is used as the null series when there is no value for the by or partition fields. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Nest.IDetector.CustomRules
member.summary: Custom rules enable you to change the behaviour of anomaly detectors based on domain-specific knowledge. Custom rules describe when a detector should take a certain action instead of following its default behaviour. To specify the "when", a rule uses a scope and conditions. You can think of scope as the categorical specification of a rule, while conditions are the numerical part. A rule can have a scope, one or more conditions, or a combination of scope and conditions.

member.name: T:Nest.IFieldNameDetector
member.summary: A machine learning detector with a field name

member.name: P:Nest.IFieldNameDetector.FieldName
member.summary: The field that the detector uses in the function. If you use an event rate function such as count or rare, do not specify this field.

member.name: T:Nest.IByFieldNameDetector
member.summary: A machine learning detector with a by field

member.name: P:Nest.IByFieldNameDetector.ByFieldName
member.summary: The field used to split the data. In particular, this property is used for analyzing the splits with respect to their own history. It is used for finding unusual values in the context of the split.

member.name: T:Nest.IOverFieldNameDetector
member.summary: A machine learning detector with an over field

member.name: P:Nest.IOverFieldNameDetector.OverFieldName
member.summary: The field used to split the data. In particular, this property is used for analyzing the splits with respect to the history of all splits. It is used for finding unusual values in the population of all splits.

member.name: T:Nest.IPartitionFieldNameDetector
member.summary: A machine learning detector with a partition field

member.name: P:Nest.IPartitionFieldNameDetector.PartitionFieldName
member.summary: The field used to segment the analysis. When you use this property, you have completely independent baselines for each value of this field.

member.name: M:Nest.DetectorDescriptorBase`2.DetectorDescription(System.String)
member.summary: A description of the detector. For example, "Low event rate".

member.name: M:Nest.DetectorDescriptorBase`2.ExcludeFrequent(System.Nullable{Nest.ExcludeFrequent})

If you are working with both over and by fields, then you can set exclude_frequent to all for both fields, or to by or over for those specific fields.

member.name: M:Nest.DetectorDescriptorBase`2.UseNull(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Defines whether a new series is used as the null series when there is no value for the by or partition fields. The default value is false.

member.summary: A unique identifier for the detector. This identifier is based on the order of the detectors in the analysis config, starting at zero. You can use this identifier when you want to update a specific detector.

member.summary: Custom rules enable you to change the behaviour of anomaly detectors based on domain-specific knowledge. Custom rules describe when a detector should take a certain action instead of following its default behaviour. To specify the "when", a rule uses a scope and conditions. You can think of scope as the categorical specification of a rule, while conditions are the numerical part. A rule can have a scope, one or more conditions, or a combination of scope and conditions.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.EmptyBucketCount
member.summary: The number of buckets which did not contain any data. If your data contains many empty buckets, consider increasing your bucket_span or using functions that are tolerant to gaps in data such as mean, non_null_sum or non_zero_count.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.InputBytes
member.summary: The number of raw bytes read by the job.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.InputFieldCount
member.summary: The total number of record fields read by the job. This count includes fields that are not used in the analysis.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.InputRecordCount
member.summary: The number of data records read by the job.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.InvalidDateCount
member.summary: The number of records with either a missing date field or a date that could not be parsed.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.JobId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the job.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.LastDataTime
member.summary: The timestamp at which data was last analyzed, according to server time.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.LatestEmptyBucketTimestamp
member.summary: The timestamp of the last bucket that did not contain any data.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.LatestRecordTimestamp
member.summary: The timestamp of the last processed record.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.LatestSparseBucketTimestamp
member.summary: The timestamp of the last bucket that was considered sparse.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.MissingFieldCount
member.summary: The number of records that are missing a field that the job is configured to analyze. Records with missing fields are still processed because it is possible that not all fields are missing. The value of includes this count.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.OutOfOrderTimestampCount
member.summary: The number of records that are out of time sequence and outside of the latency window. These out of order records are discarded, since jobs require time series data to be in ascending chronological order.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.ProcessedFieldCount
member.summary: The total number of fields in all the records that have been processed by the job. Only fields that are specified in the detector configuration contribute to this count. The time stamp is not included in this count.

member.name: P:Nest.DataCounts.ProcessedRecordCount
member.summary: The number of records that have been processed by the job. This value includes records with missing fields, since they are nonetheless analyzed. If you use datafeeds and have aggregations in your search query, the will be the number of aggregated records processed, not the number of Elasticsearch documents.

member.name: T:Nest.AnomalyCause
member.summary: Cause for the anomaly that has been identified for the over field.

member.name: T:Nest.AnomalyRecord
member.summary: Detailed analyticial results of anomalous activity that has been identified in the input data based on the detector configuration.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.Actual
member.summary: The actual value for the bucket.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.BucketSpan
member.summary: The length of the bucket. This value matches the that is specified in the job.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.ByFieldName
member.summary: The name of the analyzed field. This value is present only if it is specified in the detector.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.ByFieldValue
member.summary: The value of . This value is present only if it is specified in the detector.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.Causes
member.summary: For population analysis, an over field must be specified in the detector. This property contains an array of anomaly records that are the causes for the anomaly that has been identified for the over field. If no over fields exist, this field is not present. Contains the most anomalous records for the . For scalability reasons, a maximum of the 10 most significant causes of the anomaly are returned. As part of the core analytical modeling, these low-level anomaly records are aggregated for their parent over field record.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.DetectorIndex
member.summary: A unique identifier for the detector.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.FieldName
member.summary: Certain functions require a field to operate on, for example, sum(). For those functions, this value is the name of the field to be analyzed.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.Function
member.summary: The function in which the anomaly occurs, as specified in the detector configuration.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.FunctionDescription
member.summary: The description of the function in which the anomaly occurs, as specified in the detector configuration.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.Influencers
member.summary: If influencers was specified in the detector configuration, then this contains influencers that contributed to or were to blame for an anomaly.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.InitialRecordScore
member.summary: A normalized score between 0-100, which is based on the probability of the anomalousness of this record. This is the initial value that was calculated at the time the bucket was processed.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.IsInterim
member.summary: If true, this is an interim result. In other words, the anomaly record is calculated based on partial input data.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.JobId
member.summary: The unique identifier for the job that these results belong to.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.OverFieldName
member.summary: The name of the over field that was used in the analysis. This value is present only if it was specified in the detector. Over fields are used in population analysis.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.OverFieldValue
member.summary: The value of . This value is present only if it is specified in the detector.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.PartitionFieldName
member.summary: The name of the partition field that was used in the analysis. This value is present only if it was specified in the detector.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.PartitionFieldValue
member.summary: The value of . This value is present only if it is specified in the detector.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.Probability
member.summary: The probability of the individual anomaly occurring, in the range 0 to 1. This value can be held to a high precision of over 300 decimal places, so the is provided as a human-readable and friendly interpretation of this.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.RecordScore
member.summary: A normalized score between 0-100, which is based on the probability of the anomalousness of this record. Unlike , this value will be updated by a re-normalization process as new data is analyzed.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.ResultType
member.summary: Internal. This is always set to record.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.Timestamp
member.summary: The start time of the bucket for which these results were calculated.

member.name: P:Nest.AnomalyRecord.Typical
member.summary: The typical value for the bucket, according to analytical modeling.
member.remarks: Additional record properties are added, depending on the fields being analyzed. For example, if it’s analyzing hostname as a by field, then a field hostname is added to the result document. This information enables you to filter the anomaly results more easily.

member.name: P:Nest.Bucket.AnomalyScore
member.summary: The maximum anomaly score, between 0-100, for any of the bucket influencers. This is an overall, rate-limited score for the job. All the anomaly records in the bucket contribute to this score. This value might be updated as new data is analyzed.

member.summary: An array of bucket influencer objects.

member.name: P:Nest.Bucket.BucketSpan

member.summary: The maximum anomaly_score for any of the bucket influencers. This is the initial value that was calculated at the time the bucket was processed.

member.name: P:Nest.Bucket.IsInterim
member.summary: If true, this is an interim result. In other words, the bucket results are calculated based on partial input data.

member.name: P:Nest.Bucket.JobId
member.summary: The unique identifier for the job that these results belong to.

member.name: P:Nest.Bucket.PartitionScores

member.summary: Internal. This value is always set to bucket.

member.summary: The start time of the bucket. This timestamp uniquely identifies the bucket.

member.summary: The length of the bucket. This value matches the bucket_span that is specified in the job.

member.name: P:Nest.BucketInfluencer.IsInterim
member.summary: If true, this is an interim result. In other words, the influencer results are calculated based on partial input data.

member.name: P:Nest.BucketInfluencer.Probability
member.summary: The probability that the influencer has this behavior, in the range 0 to 1. This value can be held to a high precision of over 300 decimal places.

member.name: T:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest
member.summary: Creates a datafeed for a machine learning job.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.Aggregations
member.summary: If set, the datafeed performs aggregation searches.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.ChunkingConfig
member.summary: Specifies how data searches are split into time chunks.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.Frequency
member.summary: The interval at which scheduled queries are made while the datafeed runs in real time. The default value is either the bucket span for short bucket spans, or, for longer bucket spans, a sensible fraction of the bucket span.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.Indices
member.summary: A list of index names to search within, wildcards are supported.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.JobId
member.summary: A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the job.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.Query
member.summary: Describe the query to perform using a query descriptor lambda.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.QueryDelay
member.summary: The number of seconds behind real time that data is queried. For example, if data from 10:04 a.m. might not be searchable until 10:06 a.m., set this property to 120 seconds. The default value is 60s.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.ScriptFields
member.summary: Specifies scripts that evaluate custom expressions and returns script fields to the datafeed. The detector configuration in a job can contain functions that use these script fields.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.ScrollSize
member.summary: The size parameter that is used in Elasticsearch searches.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.Types
member.summary: A list of types to search for within the specified indices.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobRequest.ModelPlotConfig

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobRequest.ModelSnapshotRetentionDays

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobRequest.ResultsIndexName
member.summary: The name of the index in which to store the machine learning results. The default value is shared, which corresponds to the index name .ml-anomalies-shared.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.AnalysisConfig
member.summary: The analysis configuration, which specifies how to analyze the data.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.AnalysisLimits
member.summary: Optionally specifies runtime limits for the job.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.BackgroundPersistInterval
member.summary: Advanced configuration option. The time between each periodic persistence of the model. The default value is a randomized value between 3 to 4 hours, which avoids all jobs persisting at exactly the same time. The smallest allowed value is 1 hour.
member.remarks: For very large models (several GB), persistence could take 10-20 minutes, so do not set the background_persist_interval value too low.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.CreateTime
member.summary: The time the job was created.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.ModelPlotConfig
member.summary: This advanced configuration option stores model information along with the results. This adds overhead to the performance of the system and is not feasible for jobs with many entities

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.ModelSnapshotId
member.summary: A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the model snapshot.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.ModelSnapshotRetentionDays
member.summary: The time in days that model snapshots are retained for the job. Older snapshots are deleted. The default value is 1 day.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.RenormalizationWindowDays
member.summary: Advanced configuration option. The period over which adjustments to the score are applied, as new data is seen. The default value is the longer of 30 days or 100 bucket_spans.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.ResultsIndexName
member.summary: The name of the index in which to store the machine learning results. The default value is shared, which corresponds to the index name .ml-anomalies-shared.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutJobResponse.ResultsRetentionDays
member.summary: Advanced configuration option. The number of days for which job results are retained. Once per day at 00:30 (server time), results older than this period are deleted from Elasticsearch. The default value is null, which means results are retained.

member.remarks: For very large models (several GB), persistence could take 10-20 minutes, so do not set the background_persist_interval value too low.

member.name: P:Nest.PutJobResponse.ResultsIndexName
member.summary: The name of the index in which to store the machine learning results. The default value is shared, which corresponds to the index name .ml-anomalies-shared.

member.name: P:Nest.PutJobResponse.ResultsRetentionDays
member.summary: Advanced configuration option. The number of days for which job results are retained. Once per day at 00:30 (server time), results older than this period are deleted from Elasticsearch. The default value is null, which means results are retained.

member.name: T:Nest.IRevertModelSnapshotRequest

member.name: P:Nest.IRevertModelSnapshotRequest.DeleteInterveningResults
member.summary: If true, deletes the results in the time period between the latest results and the time of the reverted snapshot. It also resets the model to accept records for this time period. The default value is false.

member.name: T:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest
member.summary: Updates a datafeed for a machine learning job.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.Aggregations
member.summary: If set, the datafeed performs aggregation searches.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.ChunkingConfig
member.summary: Specifies how data searches are split into time chunks.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.Frequency
member.summary: The interval at which scheduled queries are made while the datafeed runs in real time. The default value is either the bucket span for short bucket spans, or, for longer bucket spans, a sensible fraction of the bucket span.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.Indices
member.summary: A list of index names to search within, wildcards are supported.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.JobId
member.summary: A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the job.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.Query
member.summary: Describe the query to perform using a query descriptor lambda.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.QueryDelay
member.summary: The number of seconds behind real time that data is queried. For example, if data from 10:04 a.m. might not be searchable until 10:06 a.m., set this property to 120 seconds. The default value is 60s.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.ScriptFields
member.summary: Specifies scripts that evaluate custom expressions and returns script fields to the datafeed. The detector configuration in a job can contain functions that use these script fields.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.ScrollSize
member.summary: The size parameter used in searches.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateDatafeedRequest.Types
member.summary: A list of types to search for within the specified indices.

member.summary: Update a machine learning Job

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.AnalysisLimits
member.summary: Optionally specifies runtime limits for the job. Requires a restart.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.BackgroundPersistInterval
member.summary: The time between each periodic persistence of the model. The default value is a randomized value between 3 to 4 hours, which avoids all jobs persisting at exactly the same time. The smallest allowed value is 1 hour. Requires a restart.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.CustomSettings
member.summary: Contains custom meta data about the job.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.Description
member.summary: An optional description of the job

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.ModelPlotConfig
member.summary: This advanced configuration option stores model information along with the results. This adds overhead to the performance of the system and is not feasible for jobs with many entities

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.ModelSnapshotRetentionDays
member.summary: The time in days that model snapshots are retained for the job. Older snapshots are deleted. The default value is 1 day.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.RenormalizationWindowDays
member.summary: The period over which adjustments to the score are applied, as new data is seen.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.ResultsRetentionDays
member.summary: The number of days for which job results are retained. Once per day at 00:30 (server time), results older than this period are deleted from Elasticsearch. The default value is null, which means results are retained.

member.name: T:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest
member.summary:
This API enables you to create a rollup job. The job will be created in a STOPPED state, and must be started with the Start Job API.
You must have manage or manage_rollup cluster privileges to use this API.

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.Cron
member.summary: A cron string which defines when the rollup job should be executed.

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.Groups
member.summary: Defines the grouping fields that are defined for this rollup job

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.IndexPattern
member.summary: The index, or index pattern, that you wish to rollup. Supports wildcard-style patterns (logstash-*).

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.Metrics
member.summary: Defines the metrics that should be collected for each grouping tuple

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.PageSize
member.summary: The number of bucket results that should be processed on each iteration of the rollup indexer. A larger value will tend to execute faster, but will require more memory during processing.

member.name: T:Nest.IDateHistogramRollupGrouping
member.summary: A date_histogram group aggregates a date field into time-based buckets. The date_histogram group is mandatory , you currently cannot rollup documents without a timestamp and a date_histogram group

member.name: P:Nest.IDateHistogramRollupGrouping.Delay
member.summary: How long to wait before rolling up new documents. By default, the indexer attempts to roll up all data that is available.

member.name: P:Nest.IDateHistogramRollupGrouping.Field
member.summary: The date field that is to be rolled up

member.name: P:Nest.IDateHistogramRollupGrouping.Interval
member.summary: The interval of time buckets to be generated when rolling up. E.g. "60m" will produce 60 minute (hourly) rollups. The interval defines the minimum interval that can be aggregated only.

member.name: P:Nest.IDateHistogramRollupGrouping.TimeZone
member.summary: Defines what time_zone the rollup documents are stored as. Unlike raw data, which can shift timezones on the fly, rolled documents have to be stored with a specific timezone. By default, rollup documents are stored in UT

member.name: P:Nest.IDateHistogramRollupGrouping.Format
member.summary: Date format. Supports expressive date format pattern.

member.name: T:Nest.IHistogramRollupGrouping
member.summary: The histogram group aggregates one or more numeric fields into numeric histogram intervals.

member.name: P:Nest.IHistogramRollupGrouping.Fields
member.summary: The set of fields that you wish to build histograms for. All fields specified must be some kind of numeric. Order does not matter

member.name: P:Nest.IHistogramRollupGrouping.Interval
member.summary: The interval of histogram buckets to be generated when rolling up. Note that only one interval can be specified in the histogram group, meaning that all fields being grouped via the histogram must share the same interval.

member.name: T:Nest.IRollupGroupings
member.summary: The groups section of the configuration is where you decide which fields should be grouped on, and with what aggregations. These fields will then be available later for aggregating into buckets

member.name: T:Nest.ITermsRollupGrouping
member.summary: The terms group can be used on keyword or numeric fields, to allow bucketing via the terms aggregation at a later point. The terms group is optional. If defined, the indexer will enumerate and store all values of a field for each time-period.

member.name: P:Nest.ITermsRollupGrouping.Fields
member.summary: The set of fields that you wish to collect terms for. This array can contain fields that are both keyword and numerics. Order does not matter

member.name: P:Nest.IPutUserRequest.Password
member.summary: The user’s password. Passwords must be at least 6 characters long.
member.remarks: When adding a user, one of or is required. When updating an existing user, the password is optional, so that other fields on the user (such as their roles) may be updated without modifying the user’s password.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutUserRequest.PasswordHash
member.summary: A hash of the user’s password. This must be produced using the same hashing algorithm as has been configured for password storage. Using this parameter allows the client to pre-hash the password for performance and/or confidentiality reasons. The parameter and the parameter cannot be used in the same request.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutUserRequest.Roles
member.summary: A set of roles the user has. The roles determine the user’s access permissions. To create a user without any roles, specify an empty list.

member.name: T:Nest.IConditionContainer
member.summary: Conditions for a watch

member.name: P:Nest.IConditionContainer.Always
member.summary: Forces the watch actions to be executed unless they are throttled.

member.name: P:Nest.IConditionContainer.ArrayCompare
member.summary: Compares an array of values in the execution context to a given value.

member.name: P:Nest.IConditionContainer.Compare
member.summary: Performs a simple comparison against a value in the watch payload.

member.name: P:Nest.IConditionContainer.Never
member.summary: Watch actions are never executed when the watch is triggered. The watch input is executed, a record is added to the watch history, and the watch execution ends.
member.remarks: This condition is generally used for testing.

member.name: P:Nest.IConditionContainer.Script
member.summary: A watch condition that evaluates a script. The default scripting language is groovy. You can use any of the scripting languages supported by Elasticsearch as long as the language supports evaluating expressions to Boolean values. Note that the mustache and expression languages are too limited to be used by this condition.
member.remarks: For Groovy, you must explicitly enable dynamic scripts in elasticsearch.yml to use inline or stored scripts. To enable groovy scripting for watches only, you can set script.engine.groovy.inline.xpack_watch: true.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.ActionModes
member.summary: Determines how to handle the watch actions as part of the watch execution.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.AlternativeInput
member.summary: When present, the watch uses this object as a payload instead of executing its own input.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.IgnoreCondition
member.summary: If this is set to true the watch execution will use the Always Condition.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.RecordExecution
member.summary: If this is set to true the WatchRecord generated by executing the watch will be persisted to the .watcher_history index for the current time. Also the status of the watch is updated, possbily throttling subsequent executions.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.SimulatedActions
member.summary: This field can either be a list of action ids or the string _all. If _all is set or an action that is executed by the watch appears in this list it will be executed in simulated mode.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.TriggerData
member.summary: This structure will be parsed as a trigger event and used for the watch execution.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.Watch
member.summary: When present, this watch is used instead of the one specified in the request. This watch is not persisted to the index and record_execution cannot be set.

member.summary: The action will be simulated (not actually executed) and it will be throttled if needed.

member.name: F:Nest.ActionExecutionMode.ForceSimulate
member.summary: The action will be simulated (not actually executed) and it will not be throttled.

member.name: F:Nest.ActionExecutionMode.Execute
member.summary: The action will be executed and it will be throttled if needed.

member.name: F:Nest.ActionExecutionMode.ForceExecute
member.summary: The action will be executed and it will not be throttled.

member.name: F:Nest.ActionExecutionMode.Skip
member.summary: The action will be skipped (it won't be executed nor simulated) - effectively it will be forcefully throttled
